before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mmsv","text":"Extract and dry total starch pellet from plant tissue per Extraction of Non-Structural Carbohydrates (Total Soluble Sugars + Starch) in Plant Tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":92}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"387D2932629411ECA7400A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.protocols.io/view/extraction-of-non-structural-carbohydrates-total-s-b2jmqck6"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"16vbh","text":"Enzymatic digestion of total soluble starch to glucose in plant tissue extracts for preparation for quantification via the GOD-POD Method (NZYtech).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Realizing Increased Photosynthetic Efficiency (RIPE) that is funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Foundation for Food and Agriculture Research, and the U.K. Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

keywords: Starch, Soluble Starch, Enzymatic Digestion, Plant Tissue, GOD-POD
manuscript_citation: Pak S. Chow, Simon M. Landhäusser, A method for routine measurements of total sugar and starch content in woody plant tissues, Tree Physiology, Volume 24, Issue 10, October 2004, Pages 1129–1136, https://doi.org/10.1093/treephys/24.10.1129

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"84t25","text":"Prepare fresh daily 120 U/mL α-amylase in MOPS buffer. 1 mL per sample will be needed. Initial concentration of α-amylase is 1000 U/mL.  Use C1V1 = C2V2 to calculate the volume of α-amylase and MOPS buffer to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":142,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":144,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":149,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":151,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ans9q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"upo9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eg413","text":"α-amylase comes at 1000 U/mL concentration in a 20 mL bottle. If using all of the bottle, 20 mL of α-amylase in 146.7 mL of MOPS will result in 120 U/mL α-amylase in MOPS buffer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"616a2","text":"Prepare fresh daily 30 U/mL amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer. 1 mL per sample will be needed. Initial concentration of amyloglucosidase is 3260 U/mL.  Use C1V1 = C2V2 to calculate the volume of amyloglucosidase  and acetate buffer to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":158,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":160,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":165,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":167,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r3cf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cg3hk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aph5r","text":"To prepare 250 mL of 30 U/mL amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer, dilute 2.3 mL amyloclucosidase (3260 U/mL) into 247.7 mL acetate buffer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dllpr","text":"Add   of α-amylase in MOPS buffer (120 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpn0k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"62BEDE30634211ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bga0","text":"Vortex to suspend all solids.  Flicking the tube may help dislodge the dried starch pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bv05","text":"Add another   of α-amylase in MOPS buffer (120 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"CD7440F3634211ECA03C0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"34idt","text":"Cool down the water bath to  , tubes can be stored at room temp on the counter while water bath cools.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ccpc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"juh2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F8B8E160634211ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"50","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"afa5p","text":"Leaving the lid off, especially if it is a shaking water bath, will help cool.  For faster cooling, remove some water from the water bath and refill with cool distilled water.  Do not use tap water as mineral buildup or heated chlorine could damage the water bath. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8fuir","text":"Add   amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer (30 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55o5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"1F063830634411ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"449rd","text":"Add another   amyloglucosidase in acetate buffer (30 U/mL) to each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6pd11","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"2518A1E0634411ECB6CBC535CBD77146","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6ubk","text":"Place the tubes in ice to stop the reaction, until cool to the touch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ak6g","text":"Proceed to total starch (as glucose) quantification by NZYtech GOD-POD method or store the samples at -20°C up to one month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Total Starch Enzymatic Digestion
